Cecilia Delong, M.D.
Green Oaks Hospital
72 John Street
San Luis Obispo, MD 53925
RE: Wagner, Lonnie
MR #097-87-37-2
Dear Cecilia;
I had the pleasure of seeing Lonnie in the Clinic today. As you
know, he is a 72-year-old gentleman recently diagnosed with
myelodysplastic/myeloproliferative syndrome. He has required
blood cell transfusions for this. He is currently receiving
Hydrea for this. He also has coronary disease, for which he had
stents placed in his LAD and OM in 07/65. This has been stable.
He also had some congestive heart failure, for which he has no
further symptoms at this time. His weight is only up 1-2 pounds
but has remained stable with an increased appetite.
Medications: Include atenolol 25 mg p.o. q.d., aspirin 325 mg
q.d., vitamin B12 injections q. monthly, metformin 850 mg t.i.d.,
lisinopril 10 mg p.o. q.d., Lasix 40 mg p.o. q.d.
Physical Examination: Blood pressure: 102/60. Heart rate: 60
beats/min. Neck examination reveals no jugular venous distention
Chest examination is clear to auscultation bilaterally. Cardiac
examination reveals normal S1, physiologically split S2, no
evidence of a murmurs, rubs or gallops at this time. He has no
peripheral edema or clubbing.
EKG: Normal sinus rhythm, nonspecific ST or T wave abnormalities.
Compared to his prior EKG, T wave changes in the anterior leads
are improved.
Wagner, Lonnie
MR #097-87-37-2 -2- September 29, 2065
Impression: Mr. Wagner is doing very well from an ischemic and
heart failure perspective. He remains on a good regimen of
afterload reduction and anti-ischemic agents. At this time, I do
not recommend any changes in his cardiac medications.
The patient was seen in consultation with Dr. Jacqueline Lam.
Sincerely,
David F. Irick, M.D.
